description.narrative: Output 5.1: Child friendly social protection systems: Regional and national stakeholders have up-to-date evidence and increased capacity to develop, monitor and implement and demand child friendly social protection systems to address child related sustainable development goals., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 5. EVERY CHILD HAS AN EQUITABLE CHANCE IN LIFE. The most excluded girls, boys and adolescents in LAC benefit from equitable policies, budgets and programmes to ensure they develop to their full potential in an equitable manner in alignment with the Sustainable Development Agenda 2030.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 0843-03045 Panama Republica de Panama

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Linking cash to other programs, information and services (information on essential family practices, livelihoods, psycho-social support, etc.)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Latin America and the Caribbean Regional Evaluation Reports
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

related-activity.ref: 333R/A0/10/005 OUTCOME 5: EVERY CHILD HAS AN EQUITABLE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.1: Child friendly social protection systems: Regional and national stakeholders have up-to-date evidence and increased capacity to develop, monitor and implement and demand child friendly social protection systems to address child related sustainable development goals.

description.narrative: Regional and national stakeholders have up-to-date evidence and increased capacity to develop, monitor and implement and demand on child friendly social protection systems to address child related sustainable development goals within the LAC region. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/02/2019

title.narrative: Number of countries addressing their social protection responses to children with disability with UNICEF support
Number of countries with routine measurement of gaps in social protection coverage with UNICEF support
Number of countries addressing their social protection responses to emergencies with UNICEF support
Number of countries with initiatives or programmes oriented to the strengthening of SP systems supported by UNICEF
